Unless otherwise specified, %'s are by weight.

heading.b: Example A1: Sweetened Dried Apricot Composition

description.p: A sweetened dried apricot composition is prepared with 100 ppm sulfur dioxide, 20 mg rebaudioside A, and 1.75 g erythritol per 40 g serving of dried apricots.

heading.b: Example A2: Sweetened Cured Ham Composition

description.p: A sweetened cured ham composition is prepared with 100 mg sodium nitrate, 30 mg sodium nitrite, 2.4 g sodium chloride, 1.33 mg rebaudioside A, and 125 mg erythritol per 60 g serving of ham.

heading.b: Example A3: Sweetened Cola Beverage Composition

description.p: A sweetened diet cola beverage composition is prepared with 100 ppm sodium benzoate, 400 ppm rebaudioside A, and 3.5 % erythritol per 240 mL serving of cola beverage.
The following Examples B1-B3, C1-C3, D, E1-E3, and F illustrate methods of making purified rebaudioside A in accordance with particular embodiments of this invention:

Crude rebaudioside A (77.4% purity) mixture was obtained from a commercial source. The impurities (6.2% stevioside, 5.6% rebaudioside C, 0.6 % rebauiodioside F, 1.0 % other steviolglycosides, 3.0% rebaudioside D, 4.9% rebaudioside B, 0.3% steviolbioside) were identified and quantified using HPLC on dry basis, moisture content 4.7%.

Crude rebaudioside A (400 g), ethanol (95%, 1200 mL), methanol (99%, 400 mL) and water (320 mL) were combined and heated to 50°C for 10 minutes. - The clear solution was cooled to 22°C for 16 hours. The white crystals were filtered and washed twice with ethanol (2 x 200 mL, 95%) and dried in a vacuum oven at 50°C for 16-24 hours under reduced pressure (20 mm).

The final composition of substantially pure rebaudioside A (130 g) comprised 98.91% rebaudioside A, 0.06% stevioside, 0.03% rebaudioside C, 0.12% rebaudioside F, 0.13% other steviolglycosides, 0.1% rebaudioside D, 0.49% rebaudioside B and 0.03% steviolbioside, all by weight.

Crude rebaudioside A (80.37 %) was obtained from a commercial source. The impurities (6.22% stevioside, 2.28% rebaudioside C, 0.35% Dulcoside, 0.78 % rebaudioside F, 0.72 % other steviolglycosides, 3.33% rebaudioside B, 0.07% steviolbioside) were identified by HPLC on dry basis, moisture content 3.4%.

Crude rebaudioside A (100 g), ethanol (95%, 320 mL), methanol (99%, 120 mL) and water (50 mL) were combined and heated to 30-40°C for 10 minutes. The clear solution was cooled to 22°C for 16 hours. The white crystals were filtered and washed twice with ethanol (2 x 50 mL, 95%). The wet filter cake (88 g) was slurried in ethanol (95%, 1320 mL) for 16 hours, filtered, washed with ethanol (95%, 2 x 100 mL) and dried in a vacuum oven at 60°C for 16-24 hours under reduced pressure (20 mm).

The final composition of substantially pure rebaudioside A (72 g) comprised 98.29% rebaudioside A, 0.03% stevioside, 0.02% rebaudioside C, 0.17% rebaudioside F, 0.06% rebaudioside D and 1.09% rebaudioside B. Steviolbioside was not detected by HPLC.

Crude rebaudioside A (80.37%) was obtained from a commercial source. The impurities (6.22% stevioside, 2.28% rebaudioside C, 0.35% Dulcoside, 0.78 % rebaudioside F, 0.72 % other steviolglycosides, 3.33% rebaudioside B, 0.07% steviolbioside) were identified by HPLC on dry basis, moisture content 3.4%.

Crude rebaudioside A (50 g), ethanol (95%, 160 mL), methanol (99%, 60 mL) and water (25 mL) were combined and heated to approximately 30°C for 10 minutes. The clear solution was cooled to 22°C for 16 hours. The white crystals were filtered and washed twice with ethanol (2 x 25 mL, 95%). The wet filter cake (40 g) was slurried in methanol (99%, 600 mL) for 16 hours, filtered, washed with methanol (99%, 2 x 25 mL) and dried in a vacuum oven at 60°C for 16-24 hours under reduced pressure (20 mm).

The final composition of substantially pure rebaudioside A (27.3g) comprised 98.22% rebaudioside. A, 0.04% stevioside, 0.04% rebaudioside C, 0.18% rebaudioside F, 0.08% rebaudioside D and 1.03% rebaudioside B..Steviolbioside was not detected by HPLC.

A mixture of crude rebaudioside A (80.37 % purity, 5 g), ethanol (95%, 15 mL), methanol (5 mL) and water (3.5 mL) were combined and heated to reflux for 10 minutes. The clear solution was cooled to 22°C for 16 hours while stirring. The white crystalline product was filtered, washed twice with ethanol:methanol (5.0 mL, 3:1, v/v) mixture and dried in a vacuum oven at 50°C for 16-24 hours under reduced pressure (20 mm) to yield 2.6 g of purified product (>99% by HPLC).

A mixture of crude rebaudioside A (80.37 % purity, 5 g), ethanol (95%, 15 mL), methanol (5 mL) and water (4.0 mL) were combined and heated to reflux for 10 minutes. The clear solution was cooled to 22°C for 16 hours while stirring. The white crystalline product was filtered, washed twice with ethanol:methanol (5.0 mL, 3:1, v/v) mixture and dried in a vacuum oven at 50°C for 16-24 hours under reduced pressure (20 mm) to yield 2.3 g of purified product (>99% by HPLC).

A mixture of crude rebaudioside A (80.37 % purity, 5 g), ethanol (95%, 16 mL), methanol (6 mL) and water (2.5 mL) were combined and heated to reflux for 10 minutes. The clear solution was cooled to 22°C for 2 hours. During this time, crystals started to appear. The mixture is stirred at room temperature for 16 hours. The white crystalline product was filtered, washed twice with ethanol:methanol (5.0 mL, 8:3, v/v) mixture and dried in a vacuum oven at 50°C for 16-24 hours under reduced pressure (20 mm) to yield 3.2 g of purified product (>98% by HPLC).

A mixture of crude rebaudioside A (80.37 % purity, 50 g), ethanol (95%, 160 mL) and water (40 mL) were combined and heated to reflux for 30 minutes. The mixture was then allowed to cool to ambient temperature for 16-24 hours. The white crystalline product was filtered, washed twice with ethanol (95%, 25 mL), and dried in a vacuum oven at 60°C for 16-24 hours under reduced pressure (20 mm) to yield 19.8 g of purified product (99.5% by HPLC).

A mixture of crude rebaudioside A (41% purity, 50 g), ethanol (95%, 160 mL), methanol (99.8 %, 60 mL) and water (25 mL) were combined by stirring at 22°C. A white product crystallized out in 5-20 hours. The mixture was stirred for additional 48 hours. The white crystalline product was filtered and washed twice with ethanol (95%, 25 mL). The wet cake of white crystalline product then was slurried in methanol (99.8 %, 200 mL) for 16 hours, filtered, washed twice with methanol (99.8 %, 25 mL), and dried in a vacuum oven at 60°C for 16-24 hours under reduced pressure (20 mm) to give 12.7 g of purified product (>97%. by HPLC).

A mixture of crude rebaudioside A (48% purity, 50 g), ethanol (95%, 160 mL), methanol (99.8 %, 60 mL) and water (25 mL) was combined by stirring at 22°C. The white product crystallized out in 3-6 hours. The mixture was stirred for additional 48 hours. The white crystalline product was filtered and washed twice with ethanol (95%, 25 mL). The wet cake of white crystalline product then was slurried in methanol (99.8 %, 300 mL) for 16 hours, filtered, washed twice with methanol (99.8 %, 25 mL) and dried in a vacuum oven at 60°C for 16-24 hours under reduced pressure (20 mm) to give 18.6 g of purified product (>97% by HPLC).

A mixture of crude rebaudioside A (55% purity, 50 g), ethanol (95%, 160 mL), methanol (99.8 %, 60 mL) and water (25 mL) was combined by stirring at 22°C. The white product crystallized out in 15-30 minutes. The mixture was stirred for an additional 48 hours. The white crystalline product was filtered and washed twice with ethanol (95%, 25 mL). The wet cake of white crystalline product was slurried in methanol (99.8 %, 350 mL) for 16 hours, filtered, washed twice with methanol (99.8 %, 25 mL) and dried in a vacuum oven at 60°C for 16-24 hours under reduced pressure (20 mm) to give 22.2 g of purified product (>97% by HPLC).

A solution of rebaudioside A (>97% pure by HPLC) was prepared in double distilled water (12.5 gm in 50 mL, 25 % concentration) by stirring the mixture at 40°C for 5 minutes. An amorphous form of rebaudioside A was formed by immediately using the clear solution for spray drying with the Lab-Plant spray drier SD-04 instrument (Lab-Plant Ltd., West Yorkshire, U.K.). The solution was fed through the feed pump into the nozzle atomizer which atomized it into a spray of droplets with the help of a constant flow of nitrogen / air. Moisture was evaporated from the droplets under controlled temperature conditions (about 90 to about 97°C) and airflow conditions in the drying chamber and resulted in the formation of dry particles. This dry powder (11-12 g, H20 6.74 %) was discharged continuously from the drying chamber and was collected in a bottle. The solubility in water at room temperature was determined to be > 35.0 %.

Sensory evaluation of the samples prepared in Example Set G was carried out under the following protocol, similar to that described hereinabove. In this test protocol, none of the samples were swallowed. All samples were expectorated and the mouth was rinsed with water after the tasting. Immediately upon sensing maximal sweetness, the sample was expectorated, the mouth was rinsed with water and the rate of sweetness decay ("Sweetness Linger") was measured, where attention was focused on the sweetness 3-4 min after the water rinse. After sample tasting was complete, a salty oyster cracker was chewed followed by a water rinse, and at least 5 minutes followed before tasting the next sample. The sweetness linger was rated by a panel of experts in the sensory evaluation of foods and beverages using the following scale: 0 = no sweetness linger, 1 = very slight sweetness linger, 2 = slight sweetness linger, 3 = moderate sweetness linger, 4 = moderately high sweetness linger, 5 = high sweetness linger.

The "Sweetness Linger" rating for sucrose observed by this protocol is defined as 0. The Sweetness Linger of a 500 ppm of REBA control sample is defined as 5. Experimental samples were tasted by the same protocol, always allowing sufficient time between samples to ensure re-equilibration of the sensory system. Re-tasting of control samples during the course of the experiment was allowed and encouraged.
The comparison taste test was performed between two controls and addition of sweet taste improving additive on the onset and/or sweetness linger.

REBA is a natural non-caloric sweetener with a very clean flavor profile (i.e., only sweet) and an acceptable sweetness onset rate but with a sweetness which lingers quite noticeably more than that of carbohydrate sweeteners.

The effects of formulation change on the sweetness linger of 400 ppm REBA (equivalent to 8 g sucrose) in a citric acid/potassium citrate composition equivalent to that in a diet lemon-lime beverage were evaluated. The sweetness linger rating of this solution was determined to be 5.
8 g of sugar was dissolved in 100 ml of citrate buffer. The sweetness linger rating of this control sample was determined to be 0.

Sweet taste improving compositions were combined with a REBA solution to determine their effect on sweetness linger. Screening of the initial sample, or further dilutions, allowed identification of concentrations which were just above-threshold, herein defined as "near-threshold concentrations." The near-threshold additive concentrations, a 6-to 100-fold higher higher additive concentration (depending on the off-taste intensity), and a mid-level additive concentration (halfway between the near-threshold and higher additive concentration) were evaluated to determine the effect on sweetness linger of a REBA solution.

Formulations of a 500 ppm REBA in a phosphoric acid solution (75%) at a pH of 2.5 with phosphoric acid or a pH of 3.1 with citric acid and potassium citrate were prepared prior to the addition of the additives at the three levels of concentration.
Sensory evaluation using the protocol described in Example Set G then was used to evaluate the sweetness linger of the REBA solutions.
description.heading: Controls
description.p: 500 ppm of REBA was dissolved in one liter of carbon-treated water and phosphoric acid (75%) was added until a pH between 2.4 and 2.5 was reached. The sweetness linger rating of this control sample was determined to be 5.

10 g of sugar was dissolved in 100 ml of carbon treated water and phosphoric acid (75%) was added until a pH between 2.4 and 2.5 was reached. The sweetness linger rating of this control sample was determined to be 0.

claim.claim-text: Süßstoffzusammensetzung, umfassend mindestens ein Konservierungsmittel, Rebaudiosid A mit einer Reinheit von mindestens 80 Gew.-%, bezogen auf das Trockengewicht, in einem Steviolglykosid-Gemisch und Erythrit, wobei: das Gewichtsverhältnis von Rebaudiosid A zu Erythrit von 1:4 bis 1:800 reicht, wobei das Konservierungsmittel aus der Gruppe ausgewählt wird, die aus Mikrobiziden, Antioxidantien, Antienzymatika und deren Kombinationen besteht, wobei das Mikrobizid aus der Gruppe ausgewählt wird, die aus Sulfiten, Propionaten, Benzoaten, Sorbaten, Nitraten, Nitriten, Bakteriocinen, Essigsäure, Dimethyldicarbonat, Ethanol und Ozon besteht, wobei das Antioxidans aus der Gruppe ausgewählt wird, die aus butyliertem Hydroxytoluol, butyliertem Hydroxyanisol, tert.-Butylhydrochinon, Propylgallat, Ascorbinsäure und Tocopherol besteht, und wobei das Antienzymatikum Ethylendiamintetraessigsäure ist.

Essbare gesüßte Zusammensetzung, die mindestens eine essbare Substanz und eine Süßstoffzusammensetzung umfasst, wobei die Süßstoffzusammensetzung mindestens ein Konservierungsmittel, Rebaudiosid A mit einer Reinheit von mindestens 80 Gew.-%, bezogen auf das Trockengewicht, in einem Steviolglykosid-Gemisch und Erythrit umfasst, wobei: das Gewichtsverhältnis von Rebaudiosid A zu Erythrit von 1:4 bis 1:800 reicht, wobei das Konservierungsmittel aus der Gruppe ausgewählt wird, die aus Mikrobiziden, Antioxidantien, Antienzymatika und deren Kombinationen besteht, wobei das Mikrobizid aus der Gruppe ausgewählt wird, die aus Sulfiten, Propionaten, Benzoaten, Sorbaten, Nitraten, Nitriten, Bakteriocinen, Essigsäure, Dimethyldicarbonat, Ethanol und Ozon besteht, wobei das Antioxidans aus der Gruppe ausgewählt wird, die aus butyliertem Hydroxytoluol, butyliertem Hydroxyanisol, tert.-Butylhydrochinon, Propylgallat, Ascorbinsäure und Tocopherol besteht, und wobei das Antienzymatikum Ethylendiamintetraessigsäure ist.
Süßstoffzusammensetzung nach Anspruch 1 oder essbare gesüßte Zusammensetzung nach Anspruch 2, wobei das Rebaudiosid A eine Reinheit von mehr als 95 Gew.-%, bezogen auf das Trockengewicht, besitzt.
Süßstoffzusammensetzung nach Anspruch 1 oder essbare gesüßte Zusammensetzung nach Anspruch 2, wobei das Gewichtsverhältnis von Rebaudiosid A zu Erythrit von 1:20 bis 1:600 reicht.
Süßstoffzusammensetzung nach Anspruch 1 oder essbare gesüßte Zusammensetzung nach Anspruch 2, wobei das Gewichtsverhältnis von Rebaudiosid A zu Erythrit von 1:50 bis 1:300 reicht.
Süßstoffzusammensetzung nach Anspruch 1 oder essbare gesüßte Zusammensetzung nach Anspruch 2, wobei das Gewichtsverhältnis von Rebaudiosid A zu Erythrit von 1:75 bis 1:150 reicht.
Süßstoffzusammensetzung nach Anspruch 1 oder essbare gesüßte Zusammensetzung nach Anspruch 2, die außerdem eine süßen Geschmack verbessernde organische Säure umfasst.

Essbare gesüßte Zusammensetzung nach Anspruch 7, wobei die süßen Geschmack verbessernde organische Säure aus der Gruppe ausgewählt wird, die aus Milchsäure, Zitronensäure, Äpfelsäure, Weinsäure oder deren Kombinationen besteht.

Essbare gesüßte Zusammensetzung nach Anspruch 2, wobei die essbare Substanz aus einem Getränk, einer Frucht, einem Gemüse, einem Fleischprodukt, einem Fleisch-Nebenprodukt, einem Milchprodukt, einem Brotprodukt and einem Konfekt ausgewählt wird.

Essbare gesüßte Zusammensetzung nach Anspruch 9, wobei das Getränk aus der Gruppe ausgewählt wird, die aus einem nicht kohlensäurehaltigen Getränk, einem kohlensäurehaltigen Getränk, einer Cola, einem Getränk mit Fruchtgeschmack, einem Getränk mit Zitrusgeschmack, einem Getränk mit Zitronen-Limonengeschmack, einem Getränk mit Orangengeschmack, einer Limonade aus Kräuter- und Wurzelextrakten, einem Fruchtsaft, einem Getränk mit Fruchtgeschmack, einem fruchthaltigen Getränk, einem Gemüsesaft, einem gemüsehaltigen Getränk, einem Tee, einem Kaffee, einer Milchproduktkomponente, einem Sportgetränk, einem Energiegetränk und einem aromatisierten Wasser besteht.
The sweetener composition of claim 1 or the edible sweetened composition of claim 2, wherein the rebaudioside A has a purity greater than 95% by weight on a dry basis.
The sweetener composition of claim 1 or the edible sweetened composition of claim 2, wherein the weight ratio of rebaudioside A to erythritol is from 1:20 to 1:600.
The sweetener composition of claim 1 or the edible sweetened composition of claim 2, wherein the weight ratio of rebaudioside A to erythritol is from 1:50 to 1:300.
The sweetener composition of claim 1 or the edible sweetened composition of claim 2, wherein the weight ratio of rebaudioside A to erythritol is from 1:75 to 1:150.
The sweetener composition of claim 1 or the edible sweetened composition of claim 2, further comprising a sweet taste improving organic acid.

The edible sweetened composition of claim 7, wherein the sweet taste improving organic acid is selected from the group consisting of lactic acid, citric acid, malic acid, tartaric acid or combinations thereof.

The edible sweetened composition of claim 2, wherein the edible material is selected from a beverage, a fruit, a vegetable, a meat product, a meat by-product, a dairy product, a bread product and a confection.

The edible sweetened composition of claim 9, wherein the beverage is selected from the group consisting of a non-carbonated beverage, a carbonated beverage, a cola, a fruit-flavored beverage, a citrus-flavored beverage, a lemon-line-flavored beverage, an orange-flavored beverage, a root beer, a fruit juice, a fruit-flavored beverage, a fruit containing beverage, a vegetable juice, a vegetable containing beverage, a tea, a coffee, a dairy component, a sports drink, an energy drink and a flavored water.
Composition édulcorante selon la revendication 1 ou la composition comestible sucrante selon la revendication 2, dans laquelle le rébaudioside A a une pureté supérieur à 95% en poids sec.

Composition édulcorante selon la revendication 1 ou la composition comestible sucrante selon la revendication 2, dans laquelle le rapport en poids de rébaudioside A sur érythritol est de 1:20 à 1:600.

Composition édulcorante selon la revendication 1 ou la composition comestible sucrante selon la revendication 2, dans laquelle le rapport en poids de rébaudioside A sur érythritol est de 1:50 à 1:300.

Composition édulcorante selon la revendication 1 ou la composition comestible sucrante selon la revendication 2, dans laquelle le rapport en poids de rébaudioside A sur erythritol est de 1:75 à 1:150.
Composition édulcorante selon la revendication 1 ou la composition comestible sucrante selon la revendication 2, comprenant en outre un acide organique améliorant le goût sucré.

Composition comestible sucrante selon la revendication 7, dans laquelle l'acide organique améliorant le goût sucré est choisi dans le groupe consistant en acide lactique, acide citrique, acide malique, acide tartrique, ou les combinaisons de ceux-ci.

Composition comestible sucrante selon la revendication 2, dans laquelle la matière comestible est choisie parmi une boisson, un fruit, une légume, un produit de viande, un sous-produit de viande, un produit laitier, un produit de pain et une confiserie.

Composition comestible sucrante selon la revendication 9, dans laquelle la boisson est choisie dans le groupe consistant en une boisson non-carbonée, une boisson carbonée, un cola, une boisson avec arôme de fruit, une boisson avec arôme agrume, une boisson avec arôme citron-citron vert, une boisson avec arôme orange, une racinette, un jus de fruits, une boisson contenant des fruits, un jus de légumes, une boisson contenant des légumes, un thé, un café, un composant laitier, une boisson pour le sport, une boisson énergétique, et une eau aromatisée.
